This module allows to add a block of products known as "Frequently Bought Together" or "Who Bought This Also Bought". These Also Bought products can be further displayed using a custom widget in a location of your choice or/and in Related, Up-Sell, Cross-Sell products. This module will automatically create a list of products that were present in other customer orders, along with the currently viewed product. These products list is updated automatically according to the cron schedule you configure or manually in the Admin or using CLI command.

Collect products that were present in other customer orders along with the product being viewed in a separate table using: Cron (automatically according to schedule). Update Products button in Admin. CLI command. Show Also Bought products in: custom VCT Also Bought widget(s). Related, Up-Sell, Cross-Sell products. Show Also Bought products in a widget(s) for: Specific products manually selected. All product types, Bundle, Configurable, Downloadable, Grouped, Simple, Virtual products. Show or hide Also Bought products in Related, Up-Sell, Cross-Sell products. Show random Also Bought products instead of last purchased products in a custom VCT Also Bought widget, Related, Up-Sell, Cross-Sell products. Configure Also Bought widget: Set title for widget(s). Show or hide the following product card elements in Also Bought widget of your choice separately for each widget: Product image, Price box. Reviews summary (products rating and number of reviews). Add To Cart, Add To Wish List, Add To Compare buttons. Configurable products options in case of Visual Swatch or Text Swatch. Set Also Bought widget location of your choice from the following containers: After Page Header, After Page Header Top, Alert Urls. Before Main Columns, Main Content Top, Main Content Container, Main Content Area, Main Content Aside, Main Content Bottom. Mini-Cart Promotion Block. Page Header, Page Header Container, Page Header Panel, Page Top, Page Bottom. Product Auxiliary Info, Product Info Auxiliary Container, Product Social Links Container, Product View Extra Hint, Review Form Fields Before. Sidebar Main, Sidebar Additional, Compare Link Wrapper. Before Page Footer, Page Footer, Before Page Footer Container, Page Footer Container, CMS Footer Links.

Wide customization of the Also Bought product block by implementing it with a widget. Tested and verified by Adobe Extension Quality Program. Meets Magento Coding Standard. Plugins (Interceptors) are used to prevent conflicts among modules.

Use Composer to install the module or download the code for review: Log in to your Marketplace account that purchased this module. Ensure you are using correct access keys from My Profile Access Keys page. Paste the Public Key and Private Key in auth.json file inside your project e.g.: auth.json ... "http-basic": { "repo.magento.com": { "username": "<Public Key>", "password": "<Private Key>" } } ... Ensure the file is renamed from auth.json.sample to auth.json. Run the following commands: composer require vct/alsobought # Install module with Composer bin/magento setup:upgrade # Update the database schema and data bin/magento setup:static-content:deploy --force # Deploy static view files bin/magento setup:di:compile # Compile the code Help for common issues is on the FAQ page. For further assistance, please contact me by email vct.vendor@gmail.com. Get your authentication keys and install an extension in the Magento documentation.
Flush Magento Cache in SYSTEM Tools Cache Management after configuration change to see the changes! Clean and flush cache types in the Magento documentation.

Use a custom VCT Also Bought widget to display Also Bought products: Content ELEMENTS Widgets Add Widget WIDGET SETTINGS Type VCT Also Bought. Widget configs can be set separately for each widget. Creating and managing widgets in the Magento documentation. Content ELEMENTS Widgets [VCT Also Bought] WIDGET Widget Options: Config Type Default Description Widget Block Title string none Widget block title in the frontend. Random Products Yes No No Yes to display random and No to display newest Also Bought products. Products Number int 5 Number of displayed Also Bought products. Number Of Columns int 5 Number of columns display in Also Bought widget. Show Product Image Yes No Yes Show or hide product image(s). Show Reviews Summary Yes No Yes Show or hide product rating and number of reviews. Show Price Yes No Yes Show or hide product price. Show Swatches Yes No No Show or hide swatches (configurable products options). Show Add To Cart Yes No Yes Show or hide Add To Cart button. Show Add To Wish List Yes No Yes Show or hide Add To Wish List button. Show Add To Compare Yes No Yes Show or hide Add To Compare button. To display products in a single row, set the Number Of Columns to a value equal to or greater than the Products Number.

Changes in Also Bought product list will be visible in the frontend only after updating the products using: cron (scheduled tasks) in Stores SETTINGS Configuration ADVANCED System Cron (Scheduled Tasks) Cron configuration options for group: vct_alsobought. Update Products button in Admin in Stores SETTINGS Configuration VCT Also Bought Update. bin/magento vct:alsobought:update command. Configure vct_alsobought cron group​ Configure Cron configuration options for group: vct_alsobought in Stores SETTINGS Configuration ADVANCED System Cron (Scheduled Tasks) to set a schedule for Also Bought products updates. By default, Also Bought products are updated with cron every 60 minutes. Cron (scheduled tasks) in the Magento documentation.

Stores SETTINGS Configuration VCT Also Bought: Config Type Default Description Show By Related Yes No Yes Yes to add Also Bought products to Related products. No to remove previously added Also Bought products from Related products. Random In Related Yes No No Yes to display random Also Bought products in Related products. No to display newest Also Bought products in Related products. Position In Related Before After After Show Also Bought products Before or After Related products. Products Number In Related int 2 Number of Also Bought products in Related products.

Stores SETTINGS Configuration VCT Also Bought: Config Type Default Description Show By Up-Sell Yes No Yes Yes to add Also Bought products to Up-Sell products. No to remove previously added Also Bought products from Up-Sell products. Random In Up-Sell Yes No No Yes to display random Also Bought products in Up-Sell products. No to display newest Also Bought products in Up-Sell products. Position In Up-Sell Before After After Show Also Bought products Before or After Up-Sell products. Products Number In Up-Sell int 2 Number of Also Bought products in Up-Sell products.

Stores SETTINGS Configuration VCT Also Bought: Config Type Default Description Show By Cross-Sell Yes No Yes Yes to add Also Bought products to Cross-Sell products. No to remove previously added Also Bought products from Cross-Sell products. Random In Cross-Sell Yes No No Yes to display random Also Bought products in Cross-Sell products. No to display newest Also Bought products in Cross-Sell products. Position In Cross-Sell Before After After Show Also Bought products Before or After Cross-Sell products. Products Number In Cross-Sell int 2 Number of Also Bought products in Cross-Sell products.

Add To Cart button in products card can cause a JavaScript error in containers containing a form tag e.g. Review Form Fields Before container. This is happening because the button itself already contains a form tag. Set Content ELEMENTS Widgets [VCT Also Bought] WIDGET Widget Options Show Add To Cart to No to disable Add To Cart button in containers with a form tag.
Only some examples are demonstrated here!

If you have not found the answer to your question: Please contact me by email vct.vendor@gmail.com. Search for the answer to your question on Adobe Commerce Marketplace Help Center. Submit a ticket on Adobe Commerce Marketplace Help Center.

You can request a refund only directly from the Adobe Commerce Marketplace. The refund period is 25 days from the date of purchase, per the Adobe Commerce refund policy. Requesting a Refund from Marketplace purchase in Commerce Marketplace Help Center. See also Customer Agreement of Marketplace. You can request a refund by following these steps: Log in to your Marketplace account that purchased this module. Go to My Profile Purchase History. Select the correct order from your order history. Request a Refund. Then fill out and send the refund order form. Marketplace Support will request information once the refund request is generated.

The Adobe Commerce Marketplace team does not have the ability to transfer extensions purchases to a different account. It is required to purchase all extensions under the primary entitled account to avoid installation and/or deployment issues. The only resolution available is initiate a refund request from the Adobe Commerce Marketplace purchasing account if allowed by Adobe Commerce refund policy. Transferring purchases to different accounts in Commerce Marketplace Help Center.

Currently, there is no demo site for the modules and there is no way to test the module before purchasing. However: Adobe Commerce Marketplace has a refund policy. Modules are tested and verified by Adobe Extension Quality Program. There is detailed documentation for each module. Please read the module documentation and FAQ before purchasing the module. For questions about the module, please contact me by email vct.vendor@gmail.com.
documents.s: Demo or module test before purchase

documents.t: The invoice for the order can be downloaded from My Profile Purchase History in your Marketplace account. The invoice does not supply the VAT or address of the seller as this is not required by the Marketplace at the current time. Marketplace order invoice in Commerce Marketplace Help Center.
Adobe Commerce Marketplace compatibility and maintenance policy in Commerce Marketplace Help Center.

Information about a module compatibility with an edition or version of Magento or Adobe Commerce can be found on the module Marketplace page in Technical Specifications Adobe Commerce platform compatibility section.

The modules are compatible with themes based on Blank and Luma default themes. Hyvä themes compatibility​ Modules are currently not compatible with Hyvä themes. Breeze themes compatibility​ Modules are currently not compatible with Breeze themes.
Please ensure that your test environment meets the system requirements of your Magento Open Source or Adobe Commerce version.
Versions 1.x.x of modules are deprecated and no longer supported. Please use version 2.x.x.

Use Composer to install the module or download the code for review: Log in to your Marketplace account that purchased this module. Available module versions are listed in the selector on My Profile My Purchases page. Ensure you are using correct access keys from My Profile Access Keys page. Paste the Public Key and Private Key in auth.json file inside your project e.g.: auth.json ... "http-basic": { "repo.magento.com": { "username": "<Public Key>", "password": "<Private Key>" } } ... Ensure the file is renamed from auth.json.sample to auth.json. Run the following commands specifying the desired package name and version: composer require <vct/packagename>:<version> # Install module with Composer bin/magento setup:upgrade # Update the database schema and data bin/magento setup:static-content:deploy --force # Deploy static view files bin/magento setup:di:compile # Compile the code Get your authentication keys and install an extension in the Magento documentation.
Composer allows updating all modules of one vendor. Use composer update vct/* command to update all VCT modules.
The only recommended way to install modules is using Composer. If you require the source code in ZIP archive for any reason, please let me know via email vct.vendor@gmail.com.
documents.s: Getting a module as ZIP archive

documents.t: Could not find a matching version of package​ Could not find a matching version of package <vct/packagename>. Check the package spelling, your version constraint and that the package is available in a stability which matches your minimum-stability (stable). Log in to your Marketplace account that purchased this module. Ensure that access keys are enabled on My Profile Access Keys page. Install again. Execute composer --version to ensure you are using Composer version 2. Execute composer self-update --2 to migrate Composer version 1 to version 2. Install again. Check that composer.json file of your project contains the Marketplace repository https://repo.magento.com/: composer.json ... "repositories": [ { "type": "composer", "url": "https://repo.magento.com/" } ], ... Add repo.magento.com repository if it is missing. Install again. Support for Composer 1 is deprecated​ <warning>Warning from https://repo.packagist.org: Support for Composer 1 is deprecated and some packages will not be available. You should upgrade to Composer 2. See https://blog.packagist.com/deprecating-composer-1-support/</warning> Execute composer --version to ensure you are using Composer version 2. Execute composer self-update --2 to migrate Composer version 1 to version 2. Install again. Deprecating Packagist.org support for Composer 1.x in Packagist.org blog.

A configurable product allows the customer to choose options from Dropdown, Multiple Select, Visual Swatch and Text Swatch input types. Configurable child products can be Simple or Virtual products without custom options. The thumbnail image in the shopping cart can be set to display the image from the configurable product record or from the product variant. Swatch attributes can be configured to not display corresponding simple product images when the swatch is selected by setting the Update Product Preview Image option value to No in Stores ATTRIBUTES Product [Attribute] Attribute Properties. The theme controls how the Image Gallery behaves when a customer switches between product variants: By default, Blank theme replaces the main product image with the image of the selected variant. By default, the Luma theme prepend the selected variant images to the configurable product images. Things to remember about configurable products in the Magento documentation.
Leave review to help in further development Marketplace Page Release Notes Quality Report Reviews

A configurable product appears to be a single product with lists of options for each variant. However, each option represents a separate product. When selecting a configurable product variant a customer will see the SKU of selected variant instead of the configurable product one. Show the SKU of selected variant instead of the configurable product one to: Improve customer experience: Communicate with the customer support by identifying the product by its SKU. Find a product among similar ones by name. When using printed catalogs, it is easier for the customer to find the product he needs by simply comparing the item SKU in the catalog and on the website.

Support Dropdown, Visual Swatch, Text Swatch attribute input types. Compatibility with most themes due to the flexibility of configuration. Validation of jQuery selector in Admin. No reloads and no AJAX requests when selecting a product. Tested and verified by Adobe Extension Quality Program. Meets Magento Coding Standard. Plugins (Interceptors) are used to prevent conflicts among modules.

Use Composer to install the module or download the code for review: Log in to your Marketplace account that purchased this module. Ensure you are using correct access keys from My Profile Access Keys page. Paste the Public Key and Private Key in auth.json file inside your project e.g.: auth.json ... "http-basic": { "repo.magento.com": { "username": "<Public Key>", "password": "<Private Key>" } } ... Ensure the file is renamed from auth.json.sample to auth.json. Run the following commands: composer require vct/changeskudynamically # Install module with Composer bin/magento setup:upgrade # Update the database schema and data bin/magento setup:static-content:deploy --force # Deploy static view files bin/magento setup:di:compile # Compile the code Help for common issues is on the FAQ page. For further assistance, please contact me by email vct.vendor@gmail.com. Get your authentication keys and install an extension in the Magento documentation.
Flush Magento Cache in SYSTEM Tools Cache Management after configuration change to see the changes! Clean and flush cache types in the Magento documentation.
Stores SETTINGS Configuration VCT Change SKU Dynamically Config: Config Type Default Description Enable Yes No No Enable or disable SKU switching when selecting options of a configurable product.

It is necessary to specify the correct selector for your frontend theme to display selected product data instead of the configurable product data on the configurable product page, when an option is selected. By default, all selectors are specified for the default Luma theme. Module compatibility with third-party themes in FAQ. The module allows you to change jQuery selector of elements for compatibility with different themes. For example selector for the product SKU is .product.attribute.sku .value: If element switching does not work after configuring the module and clearing the cache, ensure that the correct jQuery selector is specified. Stores SETTINGS Configuration VCT Change SKU Dynamically Config: Config Type Default Description SKU Selector jQuery selector .product.attribute.sku .value SKU selector. Selector validation in Admin​ The module has jQuery selector validation in Admin for selector input fields when saving configs. For example: where ..value is an invalid jQuery selector. Use .value instead of ..value in this example.
Use Product Info Switcher module to switch other elements​

If your shop is represented in the markets of D-A-CH region (Austria, Germany, Switzerland) this module may be interesting for you. (1) On the websites used for electronic commerce with consumers, the trader is to indicate clearly and unequivocally at the latest at the beginning of the ordering process..., whether any delivery restrictions apply and which means of payment are accepted. (2) In the case of a consumer contract concluded in electronic commerce that has as its subject-matter a for-a-fee service provided by the trader, the trader must provide to the consumer the information..., and must do so in a clear and comprehensible manner, displaying it prominently, immediately before the consumer places the order. (3) In case of a contract in accordance with subsection (2), the trader is to arrange the ordering situation such that the consumer explicitly confirms by their order that they enter into obligation to effect a payment. If the order is placed using a button, the obligation of the trader under sentence 1 is deemed to have been met only if this button is marked in an easy-to-read manner with nothing but the words "Order and Pay", or with equally unambiguous wording. – German Civil Code (BGB) Section 312j Special obligations vis-à-vis consumers in electronic commerce Original: (1) Auf Webseiten für den elektronischen Geschäftsverkehr mit Verbrauchern hat der Unternehmer zusätzlich zu den Angaben nach § 312i Absatz 1 spätestens bei Beginn des Bestellvorgangs klar und deutlich anzugeben, ob Lieferbeschränkungen bestehen und welche Zahlungsmittel akzeptiert werden. (2) Bei einem Verbrauchervertrag im elektronischen Geschäftsverkehr, der den Verbraucher zur Zahlung verpflichtet, muss der Unternehmer dem Verbraucher die Informationen gemäß Artikel 246a § 1 Absatz 1 Satz 1 Nummer 1, 5 bis 7, 8, 14 und 15 des Einführungsgesetzes zum Bürgerlichen Gesetzbuche, unmittelbar bevor der Verbraucher seine Bestellung abgibt, klar und verständlich in hervorgehobener Weise zur Verfügung stellen. (3) Der Unternehmer hat die Bestellsituation bei einem Vertrag nach Absatz 2 so zu gestalten, dass der Verbraucher mit seiner Bestellung ausdrücklich bestätigt, dass er sich zu einer Zahlung verpflichtet. Erfolgt die Bestellung über eine Schaltfläche, ist die Pflicht des Unternehmers aus Satz 1 nur erfüllt, wenn diese Schaltfläche gut lesbar mit nichts anderem als den Wörtern "zahlungspflichtig bestellen" oder mit einer entsprechenden eindeutigen Formulierung beschriftet ist. – Bürgerliches Gesetzbuch (BGB) § 312j Besondere Pflichten im elektronischen Geschäftsverkehr gegenüber Verbrauchern

Move an Order Summary block at the end of the checkout sidebar. Move the Place Order button after the Order Summary block. Show the checkout sidebar with Order Summary in mobile view, which is not displayed in the default Luma theme. Translate Place Order button label as Zahlungspflichtig bestellen for stores of D-A-CH region (Austria, Germany, Switzerland).
Tested and verified by Adobe Extension Quality Program. Meets Magento Coding Standard.

Run the following commands: composer require vct/placeordersidebar # Install module with Composer bin/magento setup:upgrade # Update the database schema and data bin/magento setup:static-content:deploy --force # Deploy static view files bin/magento setup:di:compile # Compile the code Help for common issues is on the FAQ page. Stores SETTINGS Configuration VCT Place Order Sidebar Config: Config Type Default Description Enable Yes No No Yes to: move an Order Summary block at the end of a checkout sidebar; move a Place Order button after a Order Summary block; display a checkout sidebar in mobile view; translate Place Order button label as Zahlungspflichtig bestellen for stores in Austria, Germany, Switzerland. No to make no changes or undo all changes.

A configurable product appears to be a single product with lists of options for each variant. However, each option represents a separate product. The price displayed on the configurable product page is the lowest price among all variants. When you click on the dropdown, it displays the additional cost of the variant. This can negatively affect sales, which will not happen if the customer is informed of the price difference in a timely manner. Hiding price difference from the dropdown of the configurable product: Increase conversion: an unexpected price difference can lead to abandoned purchases. Hiding price difference encourages customers to focus on other product attributes that may be more appealing. Increase higher-priced variant sales: with no price comparison, customers might be more inclined to choose the more expensive option that appeals to them more. Simplify decision-making: hiding price differences streamlines the decision-making process for customers, minimizing purchase deliberation and decision fatigue.
Tested and verified by Adobe Extension Quality Program. Meets Magento Coding Standard. Plugins (Interceptors) are used to prevent conflicts among modules.

Stores SETTINGS Configuration VCT Price Diff Config: Config Type Default Description Hide Yes No No Hide or display price difference in a configurable product options dropdown.
This Privacy Policy is intended to provide general information about our privacy practices. It is not a legal document, and it does not create any contractual or other legal rights or obligations.
We take your privacy seriously. To better protect your privacy we provide this privacy policy notice explaining the way your personal information is collected and used.

Where necessary, this website uses cookies to store information about a visitor's preferences and history in order to better serve the user and/or present the user with customized content. Users have the right to opt out of cookies in their browser settings.

Advertising partners and other third parties may use cookies, scripts and/or web beacons to track user activities on this website in order to display advertisements and other useful information. Such tracking is done directly by the third parties through their own servers and is subject to their own privacy policies. This website has no access or control over these cookies, scripts and/or web beacons that may be used by third parties. Learn how to opt out of Google's cookie usage.

This website track basic information about their users. This information includes, but is not limited to, IP addresses, browser details, timestamps and referring pages. None of this information can personally identify specific user to this website. The information is tracked for routine administration and maintenance purposes.

We have included links on this website for your use and reference. We are not responsible for the privacy policies on these websites. You should be aware that the privacy policies of these websites may differ from our own. We advise users to read the privacy policies of third-party websites before clicking on any links.

We may share your personal information with third-party service providers who help us operate our website and deliver our services to you. These third-party service providers are bound by confidentiality agreements and are prohibited from using your personal information for any other purpose.

The security of your personal information is important to us, but remember that no method of transmission over the Internet, or method of electronic storage, is 100% secure. While we strive to use commercially acceptable means to protect your personal information, we cannot guarantee its absolute security.

This Privacy Policy is effective as of 2023-11-04 and will remain in effect except with respect to any changes in its provisions in the future, which will be in effect immediately after being posted on this page. We reserve the right to update or change this Privacy Policy from time to time. If we make any material changes to this Privacy Policy, we will notify you by placing a prominent notice on our website.
For any questions or concerns regarding the privacy policy, please email us to vct.vendor@gmail.com.

A configurable product appears to be a single product with lists of options for each variant. However, each option represents a separate product. Redirect a product to a parent configurable product page: Increase conversion: customers are more likely to purchase a product if they can see all the available options and compare them side-by-side. Simplify decision-making: a configurable product page displays all available options, making it faster and easier to find the right product, minimizing purchase deliberation and decision fatigue. Improve SEO: a configurable product page with many possible options will have a higher page ranking than many simple products. Reduce customer confusion: eliminating duplicate product pages for simple variants, ensuring a smoother and more focused customer shopping experience. Pre-select a configurable product options when redirecting from child products: Simplify decision-making: streamlines the decision-making process for customers, minimizing decision fatigue. Show selected variant URL of a configurable product in a browser address bar both when redirecting and when selecting other configurable product options: Increase sales: bookmark or share for later purchase selected variant URL of a configurable product. Show original (canonical) selected variant URL to: Reduce customer confusion: preventing customers from seeing products with the similar or unreadable URLs.

Support Dropdown, Visual Swatch, Text Swatch attribute input types. Support for redirection of Simple or Virtual product types. No reloads and no AJAX requests when selecting a product. Tested and verified by Adobe Extension Quality Program. Meets Magento Coding Standard. Plugins (Interceptors) are used to prevent conflicts among modules.

For example, the product has the URL /mona-pullover-hoodie-s-green.html. This product is one of the variants of the configurable product with URL /mona-pullover-hoodie.html. Stores SETTINGS Configuration VCT Simple Product URL Config: Config Type Default Description Redirect To Parent Yes No No Yes to redirect /mona-pullover-hoodie-s-green.html to /mona-pullover-hoodie.html#143=167&93=53. No to not redirect /mona-pullover-hoodie.html. Redirect or not /mona-pullover-hoodie-s-green.html to a configurable product page e.g. /mona-pullover-hoodie.html with pre-selected options #143=167&93=53. Valid only for Simple or Virtual products with visibility other than Not Visible Individually that have available configurable parent product! For example:

For example, the product has the URL /mona-pullover-hoodie-s-green.html. This product is one of the variants of the configurable product with URL /mona-pullover-hoodie.html. Stores SETTINGS Configuration VCT Simple Product URL Config: Config Type Default Description Add Options To URL Yes No Yes Yes - /mona-pullover-hoodie.html#143=167&93=53. No - /mona-pullover-hoodie.html. Add or do not add selected variant options e.g. #143=167&93=53, to the configurable product URL e.g. /mona-pullover-hoodie.html, when selecting a option of a configurable product. For example:

For example, the product has the URL /mona-pullover-hoodie-s-green.html. This product is one of the variants of the configurable product with URL /mona-pullover-hoodie.html. Stores SETTINGS Configuration VCT Simple Product URL Config: Config Type Default Description Show Selected Variant URL Yes No Yes Yes to display selected product URL Key e.g. /mona-pullover-hoodie-s-green.html. No to display parent configurable product URL with a options of pre-selected variant e.g. /mona-pullover-hoodie.html#143=167&93=53. Valid only for Simple or Virtual products with visibility other than Not Visible Individually that have available configurable parent product! Enabling Show Selected Variant URL reduce confusion for customers by preventing them from seeing products with the similar, confusing or unreadable URL e.g.: /mona-pullover-hoodie-s-green.html instead of /mona-pullover-hoodie.html#143=167&93=53, /mona-pullover-hoodie-s-red.html instead of /mona-pullover-hoodie.html#143=167&93=54. For example:

Stores SETTINGS Configuration VCT Simple Product URL Config: Config Type Default Description Save Selected Variant URL Yes No No Save or do not save URL in the browser history when switching between configurable product variants. If set to Yes and the Back button is pressed in the browser, the previous selected variant will be selected instead of going back to the previous page.

ERR_TOO_MANY_REDIRECTS error may appear, when Blocks HTML output cache is disabled. Enable Blocks HTML output cache in SYSTEM Tools Cache Management. Enable or disable cache types in the Magento documentation.

A configurable product appears to be a single product with lists of options for each variant. However, each option represents a separate product. By default, when selecting a configurable product option, you see almost the same information as for a configurable product. With this module, when selecting a configurable product option, your customer will see exactly the information about the selected product. You can decide which information you want to take from the configurable product and which information from its option. You have a new store and related products have not been added for all variants of configurable products. It doesn't matter, display the related products of the configurable product for such products. Now the customer will always have recommendations, and they will be the most relevant. Configurable products will become more useful and convenient. Instead of dozens of products in a category or search that differ only size e.g. S, M or volume e.g. 500ml, 1L that only complicate the search and choice, make one configurable.

Show the following selected product data instead of the configurable product data, when an option is selected: Page Title, Name, SKU, Availability. Description, Short Description. Additional Attributes. Add To Wishlist, Add To Compare button. Review Summary, Reviews, Submit Review form. Related, Up-Sell products. Show the relevant data of a configurable product when a selected variant has no data for: Description, Short Description. Reviews. Related, Up-Sell products. Allow writing reviews for products that are Not Visible Individually. Show switchable product data in the browser console for debugging.

Compatibility with most themes due to the flexibility of module configuration. No reloads or AJAX requests to display selected product data. Support Dropdown, Visual Swatch, Text Swatch attribute input types. Tested and verified by Adobe Extension Quality Program. Meets Magento Coding Standard. Plugins (Interceptors) are used to prevent conflicts among modules.

Use Composer to install the module or download the code for review: Log in to your Marketplace account that purchased this module. Ensure you are using correct access keys from My Profile Access Keys page. Paste the Public Key and Private Key in auth.json file inside your project e.g.: auth.json ... "http-basic": { "repo.magento.com": { "username": "<Public Key>", "password": "<Private Key>" } } ... Ensure the file is renamed from auth.json.sample to auth.json. Run the following commands: composer require vct/productinfoswitcher # Install module with Composer bin/magento setup:upgrade # Update the database schema and data bin/magento setup:static-content:deploy --force # Deploy static view files bin/magento setup:di:compile # Compile the code Help for common issues is on the FAQ page. For further assistance, please contact me by email vct.vendor@gmail.com. Get your authentication keys and install an extension in the Magento documentation.
Flush Magento Cache in SYSTEM Tools Cache Management after configuration change to see the changes! Clean and flush cache types in the Magento documentation.

Choose the design that you want to use for product pages. Default Product Layout​ Default Product Layout config in Stores SETTINGS Configuration General Web Default Layouts determines the layout used by default for product pages. Configure default product layout in the Magento documentation. Product Design Layout​ Layout config in CATALOG Products [Product] Design Display Product Options In gives you the ability to apply a different layout to the product page. Product settings - Design in the Magento documentation.

Stores SETTINGS Configuration VCT Product Info Switcher Config: Config Type Default Description Switchable Elements none Page title Name Review Summary Availability SKU Add To Wishlist Button Add To Compare Button Short Description Description Additional Attributes Reviews Submit Review Form Related Up-Sell none Show one or all of the following selected product data instead of the configurable product data, when an option is selected on the configurable product page. By default, no items are selected. Use CTRL+A to select all elements or hold CTRL to unselect an element in Admin.

It is necessary to specify the correct element selector for your frontend theme to display selected product data instead of the configurable product data on the configurable product page, when an option is selected. By default, all selectors are specified for the default Luma theme. Module compatibility with third-party themes in FAQ. The module allows you to change jQuery selector of elements for compatibility with different themes. For example selector for the product SKU is .product.attribute.sku .value: If element switching does not work after configuring the module and clearing the cache, ensure that the correct jQuery selector is specified. Selector validation in Admin​ The module has jQuery selector validation in Admin for selector input fields when saving configs. For example: where ..value is an invalid jQuery selector. Use .value instead of ..value in this example. Configure elements selector​ Stores SETTINGS Configuration VCT Product Info Switcher Config: Config Type Default Description Name Selector jQuery selector .page-title .base Product name selector. Review Summary Selector jQuery selector .product-reviews-summary Product review summary selector. SKU Selector jQuery selector .product.attribute.sku .value Product SKU selector. Availability Selector jQuery selector .product-info-main .stock.available span Product availability selector. Short Description Selector jQuery selector .product.attribute.overview .value Product short description selector. A product can only be added to a wishlist or comparison if the product's visibility is other than Not visible individually. Stores SETTINGS Configuration VCT Product Info Switcher Config: Config Type Default Description Add To Wishlist Selector jQuery selector .towishlist Add To Wish List button selector. Add To Compare Selector jQuery selector .tocompare Add To Compare button selector. Depending on the product layout, tab or block will be empty or not be displayed if the product has no data for: Description, Additional Attributes, Reviews, Related, Up-Sell products. Reviews are allowed for all products, even if they are Not Visible Individually. Update status for reviews to see reviews in the frontend. Stores SETTINGS Configuration VCT Product Info Switcher Config: Config Type Default Description Description Selector jQuery selector #description .description .value Product description selector (Details tab or block). Additional Attributes Selector jQuery selector #additional Product additional attributes selector (More Information tab or block). Reviews Selector jQuery selector .review-list Product reviews selector (Reviews tab or block). Submit Review Form Selector jQuery selector .review-add Product Submit Review form selector (Reviews tab or block). Stores SETTINGS Configuration VCT Product Info Switcher Config: Config Type Default Description Related Selector jQuery selector .related Related products selector. Up-Sell Selector jQuery selector .upsell Up-Sell products selector.

Fallbacks are optional and can be selected for each element separately. Stores SETTINGS Configuration VCT Product Info Switcher Config: Config Type Default Description Short Description Fallback Description Fallback Reviews Fallback Related Fallback Up-Sell Fallback Yes No No Yes to display relevant product data of a configurable product when a selected variant has no data. No to display relevant product data of a selected variant even if no data.

This option should only be used during debugging! In production, this configuration should be disabled! Stores SETTINGS Configuration VCT Product Info Switcher Log: Config Type Default Description Enable Yes No No Show or hide switchable product data in the browser console for debugging.
